title: Plane Tests Must Use Average Pilots, NTSB Says After 737 MAX Crashes
text:
Federal accident investigators called for broad changes in decades-old engineering principles and design assumptions related to pilot emergency responses, the first formal U.S. safety recommendations stemming from two fatal Boeing Co. 737 MAX crashes.

As part of lessons learned from the crashes that took 346 lives and grounded the global MAX fleet, the National Transportation Safety Board suggested the plane maker and the Federal Aviation Administration used unrealistic tests to initially certify the jets to carry passengers....
